quote_first: “Then let’s get going,” said T. Hamilton McKenzie. He checked his watch. It was
quote_last: . With a bit of luck he might still make the meeting on time.
title: Honor Among Thieves
author: Jeffrey Archer

quote_last: train so favored by those who commute from Oxford to London every day. All the people at breakfast seemed to know each other and Stephen felt like an uninvited guest at someone else’s party.
title: Not a Penny More, Not a Penny Less
author: Jeffrey Archer

quote_first:
Lil: Morning, shug. Check the mailbox
Me: It’s literally
quote_last: Lil: It’s early, I know. Left something for you when I was out walking. I suggest you get it now.
title: Blink And We'll Miss It
author: Ginny Kochis

quote_first:
Breakfast over, my uncle drew from his pocket a small notebook, intended for scientific observations. He consulted his instruments, and recorded:
“Monday, July 1.
“Chronometer,
quote_last:
; barometer, 297 in.; thermometer, 6° (43° F.). Direction, E.S.E.”
This last observation applied to the dark gallery, and was indicated by the compass.
title: A Journey to the Centre of the Earth
author: Jules Verne

quote_first: Come on, I can’t give up yet. I’ll just sit here for a bit and enjoy the peace. I lean back and watch a little speckled bird pecking the ground nearby for a while. Then I look at my watch again:
title: The Undomestic Goddess
author: Sophie Kinsella
